Distributions

class phasegen.distributions.ProbabilityDistribution

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for probability distributions for which moments can be calculated.

abstract property mean: float

Get the mean absorption time.

Returns:

The mean absorption time.

abstract property var: float

Get the variance in the absorption time.

Returns:

The variance in the absorption time.

abstract property m2: float

Get the second (non-central) moment of the absorption time.

Returns:

The variance in the absorption time.

touch()

Touch all cached properties.

abstract cdf(t)

Cumulative distribution function.

Parameters:

t – Value or values to evaluate the CDF at.

Return type:

float | ndarray

Returns:

CDF.

abstract pdf(u)

Density function.

Parameters:

u – Value or values to evaluate the density function at.

Return type:

float | ndarray

Returns:

Density.

plot_cdf(ax: Optional[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes] = None, x: Optional[numpy.ndarray] = None, show: bool = True, file: Optional[str] = None, clear: bool = True, label: Optional[str] = None, title: str = 'CDF')

Plot cumulative distribution function.

Parameters:

  • ax (Optional[Axes]) – Axes to plot on.

  • x (Optional[ndarray]) – Values to evaluate the CDF at.

  • show (bool) – Whether to show the plot.

  • file (Optional[str]) – File to save the plot to.

  • clear (bool) – Whether to clear the plot before plotting.

  • label (Optional[str]) – Label for the plot.

  • title (str) – Title of the plot.

Return type:

axes

Returns:

Axes.

plot_pdf(ax: Optional[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes] = None, x: Optional[numpy.ndarray] = None, show: bool = True, file: Optional[str] = None, clear: bool = True, label: Optional[str] = None, title: str = 'PDF')

Plot density function.

Parameters:

  • ax (Optional[Axes]) – The axes to plot on.

  • x (Optional[ndarray]) – Values to evaluate the density function at.

  • show (bool) – Whether to show the plot.

  • file (Optional[str]) – File to save the plot to.

  • clear (bool) – Whether to clear the plot before plotting.

  • label (Optional[str]) – Label for the plot.

  • title (str) – Title of the plot.

Return type:

axes

Returns:

Axes.

class phasegen.distributions.TimeHomogeneousDistribution(pop_config: phasegen.population.PopConfig, state_space: phasegen.state_space.DefaultStateSpace, reward: phasegen.rewards.Reward = <phasegen.rewards.TreeHeightReward object>, demography: phasegen.demography.TimeHomogeneousDemography = <phasegen.demography.TimeHomogeneousDemography object>)

Bases: PhaseTypeDistribution

Phase-type distribution for a time-homogeneous model.

__init__(pop_config: phasegen.population.PopConfig, state_space: phasegen.state_space.DefaultStateSpace, reward: phasegen.rewards.Reward = <phasegen.rewards.TreeHeightReward object>, demography: phasegen.demography.TimeHomogeneousDemography = <phasegen.demography.TimeHomogeneousDemography object>)

Initialize the distribution.

Parameters:

  • pop_config (PopConfig) – The population configuration.

  • state_space (DefaultStateSpace) – The state space.

  • reward (Reward) – The reward.

  • demography (TimeHomogeneousDemography) – The demography.

property S: ndarray

Intensity matrix with rewards.

property T: ndarray

Probability transition matrix with rewards.

property s: ndarray

Exit rate vector.

property e: ndarray

Vector with ones of size n.

property alpha: ndarray

Initial state vector.

  • reward (Optional[Reward]) – The reward.

float

Returns:

class phasegen.distributions.PiecewiseTimeHomogeneousDistribution(pop_config: phasegen.population.PopConfig, state_space: phasegen.state_space.StateSpace, demography: phasegen.demography.Demography = <phasegen.demography.TimeHomogeneousDemography object>, reward: phasegen.rewards.Reward = <phasegen.rewards.TreeHeightReward object>)

Bases: PhaseTypeDistribution

Phase-type distribution for a piecewise constant population size coalescent.

max_iter = 100

Maximum number iterations in the last epoch.

  • demography (Demography) – The demography.

  • reward (Reward) – The reward.

Initial state vector.

Density

class phasegen.distributions.SFSDistribution(pop_config: phasegen.population.PopConfig, state_space: phasegen.state_space.DefaultStateSpace, state_space_BCP: phasegen.state_space.BlockCountingStateSpace, demography: phasegen.demography.Demography, pbar: bool = False, parallelize: bool = False)

Bases: PhaseTypeDistribution

Site-frequency spectrum distribution.

__init__(pop_config: phasegen.population.PopConfig, state_space: phasegen.state_space.DefaultStateSpace, state_space_BCP: phasegen.state_space.BlockCountingStateSpace, demography: phasegen.demography.Demography, pbar: bool = False, parallelize: bool = False)

Initialize the distribution.

Parameters:

  • pop_config (PopConfig) – The population configuration.

  • state_space (DefaultStateSpace) – The state space.

  • state_space_BCP (BlockCountingStateSpace) – The state space for the block counting process.

  • demography (Demography) – The demography.

  • pbar (bool) – Whether to show a progress bar.

  • parallelize (bool) – Use parallelization.

moment(k: int, i: Optional[int] = None)

Get the nth moment.

Parameters:

  • k (int) – The order of the moment

  • i (Optional[int]) – The ith SFS count. Return full SFS if not specified.

Return type:

SFS | float

Returns:

The nth moment

property cov: SFS2

If no arguments are given, get the 2-SFS, i.e. the covariance matrix of the site-frequencies.

Returns:

A 2-SFS or a single covariance value.

get_cov(i: int, j: int)

Get the covariance between the ith and jth site-frequency.

Parameters:

  • i (int) – The ith site-frequency

  • j (int) – The jth site-frequency

Return type:

float

Returns:

property corr: SFS2

If no arguments are given, get the 2-SFS, i.e. the correlation matrix of the site-frequencies. If i and j are given, get the correlation coefficient between the ith and jth site-frequency.

Returns:

The correlation coefficient matrix

get_corr(i: int, j: int)

Get the correlation coefficient between the ith and jth site-frequency.

Parameters:

  • i (int) – The ith site-frequency

  • j (int) – The jth site-frequency

Return type:

float

Returns:

Correlation coefficient

cdf(t: float | numpy.ndarray)

Cumulative distribution function.

Parameters:

t (float | ndarray) – Time.

class phasegen.distributions.Coalescent(n: typing.Union[int, typing.Dict[str, int], typing.List[int], numpy.ndarray, phasegen.population.PopConfig], model: phasegen.coalescent_models.CoalescentModel = <phasegen.coalescent_models.StandardCoalescent object>)

Bases: ABC

Coalescent distribution. This class provides probability distributions for the tree height, total branch length and site frequency spectrum.

Create object.

Parameters:

  • n (Union[int, Dict[str, int], List[int], ndarray, PopConfig]) – n: Number of lineages. Either a single integer if only one population, or a list of integers or a dictionary with population names as keys and number of lineages as values. Alternatively, a PopulationConfig object can be passed.

  • model (CoalescentModel) – Coalescent model.

Bases: Coalescent

__init__(n: typing.Union[int, typing.Dict[str, int], typing.List[int], numpy.ndarray, phasegen.population.PopConfig], demography: typing.Optional[phasegen.demography.Demography] = None, model: phasegen.coalescent_models.CoalescentModel = <phasegen.coalescent_models.StandardCoalescent object>, migration_rates: typing.Optional[typing.Dict[typing.Tuple[str, str], float]] = None, start_time: typing.Optional[float] = None, end_time: typing.Optional[float] = None, exclude_unfinished: bool = True, exclude_finished: bool = False, num_replicates: int = 10000, n_threads: int = 100, parallelize: bool = True)

Simulate data using msprime.

Parameters:

  • n (Union[int, Dict[str, int], List[int], ndarray, PopConfig]) – Number of Lineages.

  • demography (Optional[Demography]) – Demography

  • model (CoalescentModel) – Coalescent model

  • migration_rates (Optional[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float]]) – Migration matrix

  • start_time (Optional[float]) – Time when to start the simulation

  • end_time (Optional[float]) – Time when to end the simulation

  • exclude_unfinished (bool) – Whether to exclude unfinished trees when calculating the statistics

  • exclude_unfinished – Whether to exclude finished trees when calculating the statistics

  • num_replicates (int) – Number of replicates

  • n_threads (int) – Number of threads

  • parallelize (bool) – Whether to parallelize
